Built an HTTP REST Query MicroService that accepted queries on the front end and efficiently submits them to Spark, returning

Global Commercial Client Setup and Maintenance (a.k.a My Setups) application is web based
application to build global commercial clients profile, hierarchy and maintain (servicing). Tool will be
using Amex Java RA prescribed infrastructure and frameworks to serve all international markets
client setup and maintenance.
Client Setup process in My Setups application consists of following major steps.
1. Screen Company and Beneficial Owner /Legal rep information from AML perspective.
2. Complete corporate verification and risk decision to approve/decline the corporate client.
3. Build the hierarchy including diversion accounts with client requested features once the client
approved.
My Setups application users are internal Amex users from New Accounts, World services, etc…
their profile will be defined in Global registration system with predefined permissions assigned to
their profile based on their role in Amex organization and My Setups access to certain
functions/screens will be allowed based on these permissions defined.
Hierarchy is one of the critical components in the Corporate Card process. Hierarchy is defined
across different levels to meet Amex commercial clients various reporting and billing needs.

Menomonee Falls, WI
Sole developer working on SOS (Scalable Orders Services) to provide REST-API for searching Orders and Shipments. SOS has
two components: Feeder and Engine. Feeder will consume messages from 3 topics of Kafka and update data in SOLR and
Cassandra. Working on Spring Boot and Apache Camel to route messages received from different topics in feeder. Engine consists
of 5 REST APIs: Order search, Order List, Order details, Order status and Shipment search. For all these 5 API’s, engine will read
data from SOLR and Cassandra. The response time of the API’s is less than 500ms and average request for each API is 20000/Hr.
Using Jenkins to deploy the Docker images on Openshift pods running on Google cloud.
Built from scratch, Initial Data Load (IDL) application which is a Spring Boot batch process. IDL loads data from CSV to SOLR
and Cassandra. First, IDL will split each CSV into 10 partitions and then 10 threads would write data to Cassandra. Once data is
loaded from 5 CSV’s in Cassandra, IDL will read from Cassandra and insert data in SOLR (Orders core and Shipment core).
Deployed IDL on Google Cloud VM and used an in memory H2DB to track the progress of IDL.
Built from scratch, Daily Sync Job (DSJ) which is a Spring Boot batch process. DSJ reads data from Order Management System
database (Oracle) and updates data in Cassandra. DSJ is a single step job, which would execute a PL/SQL query to retrieve data
from OMS database for orders of past two days which are in status (Expired pick up, Invoiced, Ready for Customer Pick Up) and
update the orders in Cassandra so that Kohl’s website is synchronized with OMS records. Used an in memory H2DB to track
progress of DSJ. Used Airflow to schedule the job to run at midnight, configured service now incident to be generated if the job
fails. Using Jenkins to deploy the Docker images on Openshift pods running on Google cloud.",,Senior Software Engineer,WI,109957999.pdf

Graduate Research Assistant:
 My work can be broadly described as the amalgamation of Statistical Learning techniques and Signal
Processing theory.
 Applied these methods in snippets of physiological data to develop statistical models.
 Developed a Generative model that would be able to detect and reconstruct skin conductance
changes from severely under-sampled Electrodermal activity.
 It was a Likelihood and prior based model. The Likelihood was developed based on the functional
form of skin conductance changes and the priors were based on the a priori knowledge of the
parameters used in the functional form. This resulted in a posterior which was maximized to
estimate the parameters for further detection/reconstruction of the skin conductance changes.",,Graduate Research Assistant,University of Toledo,120468156.pdf

Project Description 1:
SKMS provides a platform to answer scientific questions that arise during a drug discovery project in a
structured manner so that the knowledge generated can be easily shared and re-used by other Merck
scientists. The aim is to provide an intuitive web based system that significantly speeds up the
generation and sharing of reports that are created during the drug discovery process.
Responsibilities:
Worked as a primary developer for building an application to store/collect and share scientific
knowledge across the departments using Python/Django backend and using Aurelia JS to build an
Intuitive front end to answer the questions,
generate reports, collect data (or) visualize the data. Used Redis as the in-memory database to speed
up the search of Gene/Indications(diseases) lookup. Involved in gathering the requirements from the
end users. Used Microsoft Graph
API's to enable collaborative authoring of documents/research plans with in the application.
Environment: Python, Django, PostgreSQL, Aurelia JS, HTML 5, Pdf JS, Annotator JS, Git, Jenkins, Redis,
AWS

source reading
application, Utopia Docs with its functionality ported to be fully web based instead of a thick client. The
main purpose
is to Build an information repository (encyclopedia) of targets that has been or will be evaluated and/or
pursued by Merck which can be easily mined, allows for collaborative knowledge capture and updates
and can be accessed
intuitively for use by researchers.
Responsibilities:

by customizing

Environment: Python, Django, PostgreSQL, Aurelia JS, HTML 5, Pdf JS, Annotator JS, Git, Jenkins, Redis,

way organizations test their recovery strategies.
We sell a web-based management system for testing business continuity plans,
ensuring preparedness of employees and answering the question for organizations
“Will our recovery plans work during a real business disruption?”. Our system,
called Themis, replaces email communication and excel-spreadsheet that are
currently used to manage business continuity testing. It automatically
distributes, collects and compiles testing data across an organization and
tracks if requirements, set by compliance, are met. Engagement of test
participants is also improved through its mobile and tablet integration, which
allows them to access and input exercise information anytime, anywhere. Unlike
competitors, Themis is an application built solely for the purpose of improving
preparedness in organizations through exercising.
Cobar Systems's solutions are built with modern web technologies; allowing for

be cross-platform and browser compatible, feature real-time communication, and

Project Name: OpenStack Ironic
Project description:
Ironic is a Core OpenStack project which aims to provision bare metal servers in a manner
of virtual machines, forked from the Nova Baremetal driver. It is best thought of as a bare
metal hypervisor API and a set of plugins which interact with the bare metal hypervisors.
By default, it will use PXE and IPMI in concert to provision and turn on/off machines, but
Ironic also supports vendor-specific plugins which may implement additional functionality.

agement software for world’s biggest operators of
wireless and wired networks, such as 2.5G, 3G,
LTE, IPTV, PSTN etc. The software is used to mon-
itor the quality of network services and network el-
ements by constantly calculating vital metrics (key
performance indicators, KPI) and aggregating them
into higher level data mining metrics (key qual-
ity indicators, KQI) for SLA. Software is constantly
used in conjunction with Inventory OSS (or other
sources of inventory information) to keep track of
network elements being monitored.
The integra-
tion part consists of development of integration mod-
ules, which allow to gather required data from dif-
ferent sources and use that data to calculate KPIs.
Additionally, inventory adapters can be built to
update inventory information.
The ﬁnal type is
Fault adapters, which can be used to monitor net-
work faults. All the three types can work close to
each other exchanging information. The project is
a project of a full cycle - meaning that for each cus-
tomer involved a full range of services is provided
by the team:
requirements testing, cope imple-
mentation, testing, deployment, support and doc-
umentation.

Project Descrip-
tion:
Distributed automated platform for navigating merchant sites and perform
wide range of tasks (validating coupon codes with machine learning, collecting
product information, crawling offers, gathering location information, checking
gift cards balance). Genie learns about a merchant through natural & machine
learning. Every retailer chosen is analyzed based on their checkout flow
process. Genie is trained to learn certain common things, such as the price
changes, new website layouts. Each retailer has its own specifications. Genie
starts then determining what specific messages for that particular checkout
mean through machine learning. Platform dynamically scales number of AWS
Spot/On-Demand instances that are used for processing. My improvements to
the project have resulted over $100k in savings each year and doubled number
of merchants that team can support.

Project Descrip-
tion:
It was an addition to another system, it can be thought about as Firewall which
processes large number of requests 30-50m daily. In general the driver behind
this project is to support the web integration features for some other projects
that are used to protect enterprises against Internet threats.
It has system that constantly updates its data store with updates from other
systems and stores them in format that is optimized for reading from historical
prospective, also it exposes API that allows other systems to make queries to
retrieve different information for a URL(s) at the given time, enabling training
systems to train correctly their efficacy, as well as give the support team the
tools it needs to provide customer support, and enable efficacy engineering
team to write appropriate rules to achieve desired efficacy.

Massive Open Online Course
Project Descrip-
tion:
Learning Today is a massive open online course that hosts online courses in a
wide range of IT categories.
Project is intended to allow students to subscribe to courses of their interest,
study lectures (which can contain text/video or some interactive material),
and pass test after each lecture. To complete course user is required to receive
some number of points.
After user passes final test in course, for each unique user, there are recom-
mended books depending on his success. He can take those recommended
books from library to read. Workers of library can monitor book availability,
add/edit/delete books.
Project has admin panel for teachers and administrators, where teachers can
add/edit/delete courses, lectures, tests, and administrators can add/edit/
delete users and categories.
Project is based on Pyramid framework and uses Ajax and REST approaches.

Responsible for the whole RDS (Relational Database Service) architecture and development.
The RDS version 1.0 was launched on October 2014. (Qingcloud.com is a public IaaS/PaaS
provider in China.)
Project details
. Every RDS version 1.0 instance is a circular replication of 2­node MySQL, which is
composed of a master and a slave, and every node is running on an individual virtual
machine. Automatically, a slave node may be promoted if the master is unavailable.
. There are optimised MySQL configurations for OLTP.
. Users could do a hot­backup on the RDS while an automatic hot­backup will be taken in
everyday, At any stage the the automatic hot­backup time can be changed by user.
. RDS supports to online resize the CPU, memory and disk, the slave node will be resized
first, after that, the RDS would promote the slave to master and resize the new slave node.
. Users could be alarmed by SMS/Email for any monitor items’ dangerous thresholds, such as
disk usage, CPU usage, Questions of MySQL, Threads_running of MySQL, and many other
MySQL states.
Techniques involved
. Python ­ All of the RDS backend management system was written in Python.
. ZeroMQ ­ Use the ZMQ to distribute messages to different physical machines.
. PostgreSQL ­ The RDS relational information is stored at PostgreSQL.
. ZooKeeper ­ Used to implement different locks, such as distributed global lock, RDS
instance lock.
. KVM/QEMU/libvirt ­ Build IaaS environment by these techniques.
. jenkins ­ Continuous integration system.",,Python System Engineer,­ Present,3638344.pdf
2780,September 2010 ,"
Developed douban.com infrastructure DAE (Douban App Engine, which is a private PaaS in
Douban site) from the ground up. And responsible for implementations of distributed
daemons, servers configuration management, deployment tools, packages requirement
management, DAE APIs and many other components. To this day, there are literally
hundreds of applications on DAE, such as www.douban.com, movie.douban.com,
book.douban.com. (Douban.com is a top­level SNS site in China, which may be the largest
Python powered web site in the world.)
Project details
. Distributed daemons ­ Application could setup some daemons to DAE, DAE would ensure
the daemons were running on proper physical machines, and guarantee the daemons count
was expected.
. Servers configuration ­ A management for applications’ configurations, including nginx,
daemons, thrift and many others.
. Deployment tools ­ Technically, it is a DAE web application which is responsible for
deploying and undeploying users’ applications, it builds by Flask.
Techniques involved
. Python ­ The whole DAE platform was written in Python.
. MySQL ­ DAE offers some built­in database APIs to users, the underlying storage system is
MySQL.
. Memcached ­ DAE offers some built­in cache APIs to users which is Memcached.
. ZooKeeper ­ Used to implement distributed daemons lock.
. BeansDB ­ A key­value storage system which is made by Douban.
. beanstalkd ­ DAE uses beanstalkd to implement a queue message system.
. Thrift ­ On DAE platform, users can define two different applications, web and service.
Service application is built by the Apache Thrift.
. jenkins ­ Continuous integration system.
. pip ­ Patch some codes in pip to gear to DAE’s packages management.
­ “requirements.txt” file ­ Install some requirement packages that are not listed in “setup.py”,
then you can specify them with version control addresses, like git, SVN or Mercurial.
­ “ignore­requirements.txt” file ­ Skip some requirement packages even though they are
listed in “setup.py” or “requirements.txt”.
­ detect requirement packages ­ Specify a package name, the “pip install” would detect and
install its all requirement packages, include requirements’ requirements no matter they are
listed in “setup.py” or “requirements.txt”.
Co­founder, Python Software Engineer, Aitao.com, Chengdu.",,Python System Engineer,­ February 2014,3638344.pdf
